page.title: 07Shiney Row Roundabout
page.content: The roundabout was officially opened on December 8th 1975 and now dominates the village of Shiney Row. It was constructed at the crossroads of the A183 Chester-le-Street to Sunderland road and the A182 Houghton-le-Spring to Washington road. This was made necessary because of the construction of the{A182 Washington Highway,}a main through route for the New Town which terminates at{Shiney Row Roundabout. The roundabout has transformed Shiney Row into a{transport node}and totally changed its character. To construct the roundabout two churches, two pubs and a number of streets of houses were demolished and the War Memorial had to be resited. As Shiney Row is the major shopping centre access to the shops for the residents of Penshaw is now by{sub-way which runs under the roundabout.
